column4: hmm, I can't connect with vnc to my desktop, when I'm sure I have vnc enabled, where can I check this and how do I enable vnc-access over ssh ?
the server running vnc server probably isnt using vnc over ssh.
from the client box try and telnet to the server box on port 5900
I just meant that I can access the pc over ssh, but I can't connect with VNCviewer
can I do this in pyttu also (/me on a windows machine atm)
you can do it from a windows console also
nothing really happens ...
define "nothing"
I think the connection refused
ok, then either a firewall is blocking it or vnc isnt running
how did you start the vnc server?
I think I enabled vnc access a while ago on my desktop, from the menu, but .. that was in gnome, I have kde running atm, so could it be it isn't enabled in kde yet ?
what is the output of netstat -tpan |grep 5900
if I do that with ssh on the machine itself ?
yep
says nothing
ok, then vnc isnt running
you might be able to...  you can try doing DISPLAY=:0 vino-server
DISPLAY=:0 vino-server & might be better
hrm, you must have some other vnc server installed then.  of course I have no idea what that might be
